definition: an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.chinese: 或哪個靜靜的堡寨山村。

definition: to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
fire beacon tower (used in frontier regions in former times to relay information about the enemy, using smoke by day and fire at night)

Yingpan, common place name ("army camp")/place near Jintian village 金田村[Jin1 tian2 cun1] in Guangxi where the Taiping Tianguo rebels took their oaths in 1851/place in Xinfeng county 新豐縣|新丰县[Xin1 feng1 Xian4] traditional camping place of brigands/Yingpan township, place name/Yingpan in Shangluo prefecture, Shaanxi/Yingpan township in Yunnan/(many others)
Tucheng city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
